settings.title: How do I switch between Fahrenheit & Celsius?
settings.content: Locate the ‘Memory’ and ‘Mode’ buttons on the side of the thermometer. Hold both buttons down simultaneously until you hear a beep.

settings.title: What do the Red, Amber, Green displays mean?
How do I switch from Body temperature mode to measuring Food/Liquid temperatures?
settings.content: Locate the ‘Mode’ button on the side of the thermometer. Press the button until you find your desired temperature taking mode for Body or Food/Liquid use. There are 4 modes. For Body or Food/Liquid daytime use, you will hear a beep and the display will light up. For Body or Food/Liquid nighttime use, the beep is muted. A ‘moon’ symbol appears in nighttime mode.

settings.title: What is the correct distance to hold the thermometer from my child’s forehead to take a temperature?
settings.content: The correct temperature taking distance/position is approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm) from the center of the child’s forehead with the sensor aimed between the eyebrows.

settings.title: Why does the display always show green when I measure food or liquid that is hot or cold?
settings.content: When using the thermometer in Food/Liquid mode, the lighted display will always be GREEN regardless of temperature reading. After you get a temperature reading in Food/Liquid mode, ensure that the food or liquid is at a safe temperature for your baby.

settings.title: Can the thermometer be used on other body areas like in an ear or under an arm?
settings.content: No, the thermometer can only be used for the forehead, aimed between the eyebrows and not touching the skin.
